sn44.1:6.6: BB’s “mathemeticisn” is misleading. A mathemeticisn doesn’t count things, they study mathematics. What’s meant here is those who specialize in estimating or tallying things. In the past these were known as “computers”. Muddika evidently means one who counts on fingers.
sn44.1:13.2: Compare AN 11.7 for variant viggayhissati. Also, note that the idiom “yatra hi nama”, like other idiomatic uses of “nama”, often has an emphatic or exclamatory force.
